comments:
1) Start a clean workspace from scratch
2) Choose New EJB Project wizard.
3) Give it a name.
4) Uncheck Add to EAR
5) Click next.

You will get the following error and you will be asked to leave the workspace.

With the latest I build, i can see the stack trace as similar to yours when 
you  choose  JonAS  as the  server, it doesn't matter if you  choose to add to 
EAR or not.
There is already an open defect 113537  for the SAXParseException

Hi Neeraj,
Can you please explain why you moved this to jst.server? I don't see a single
jst.server on the stack traces.

It was per discussion with Chuck, please assign  to Konstantin and the 
component wst.common.

BTW the  stack in the comment #1  occurs for JonAs and not for other runtimes 
ssuch as WebSphere.
Reassigning to wst.common as per comment.

Tim,

It looks like a bunch of server runtime definitions in 
org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.serverdefinitions specify 
org.eclipse.jst.server.core.internal.RuntimeClasspathProvider$Factory as the 
classpath provider. This fails because the framework attempts to load the 
class from the bundle that the extension point is located in and 
jst.generic.serverdefinitions plugin does not specify a dependency on 
jst.server.core. Adding the dependency should fix this problem.

I will take a look at why CNF cause stack trace was not reported.
Fix dropped to HEAD, will be tagged for I-build shortly.
